experience: We're Hiring. Go to wepay.com/careers to check out our openingsWePay is a fast-growing payments company that has built the WePay API specifically for platform businesses, such as marketplaces, crowdfunding sites, and small business software.  Through this API, WePay enables online platforms to offer payments easily to their buyers and sellers.  WePay uniquely offers platforms a customized user experience while shielding them from fraud risk.  WePay’s proprietary risk technology leverages alternative data sources such as social media, platform data, and traditional business data to detect and mitigate fraud.Our Values- Success-Oriented: We're tenacious, resourceful and innovative. We do whatever it takes to succeed.- Delight Customers: We love our customers, listen to them and want to delight them. - Invest in Relationships: We value all our relationships; customers, vendors, investors, and co-workers- Authentic: We strive to remain authentic, honest, humble and transparent in everything we do.- Courage to Change: We're not afraid to rethink how something should be done to make it better. For us, the status quo is never good enough.Contract to Hire Role- Converted to Full Time 1/1/2016
What is WePay? - We're fun and friendly, and our customers love us!

Built out team to effectively source from University EventsWorked closely with Hiring Managers and Recruiting Coordinators to effectively Staff on-Campus events including interviewsClosely work with clients to determine needs and hiring processSourcing and recruiting for all technical roles for multiple North American OpenTable locations through Jobvite System, multiple search techniques, cold calling and boolean searchResponsible for screening candidates and scheduling interviews

First Recruiter hired on to drive a proactive approach to recruitment versus passive.Closely work with clients to determine need, changes to processes and build relationships from a remote location.Personally requested by Clients as the recruiter to work on high priority projects.Sourcing and recruiting for all technical roles for multiple North American Go Daddy locations through Jobvite System, multiple search techniques, cold calling and boolean search.Managing from 15-40 or more different technical positions at a time, including different levels of DBA's, Engineers, Team Leads and Directors.Responsible for screening candidates, scheduling interviews, reference checks, offer approval with Chief People Officer and teams, Offer preparation and Offer Extension.Spoke to numerous candidate tracker companies, negotiated contracts and implemented new systems with the recruiting team.Created and implemented Sourcing party’s to encourage collaboration amongst recruiters across different locations.Partnered with Hiring Managers and developers to build out a network in the brand new Kirkland office. Sourced out potential events to help build brand recognition with recruiting opportunities, worked with manager on approval for funds, and worked with clients to ensure we had the correct individuals in attendance.Helping to build out a Proactive Recruiting Function which includes new tools, trainings, ideas.Implemented first ever tech talk in the Seattle office with 50% of the attendees having interest in GoDaddy following the event.Hosted and attended events in areas local to offices to help build a presence for the organization.Built a event to be held every other week in the Denver office (before closure) to celebrate special events and team wins, helping build culture and presence in the office.Helped to create a new Employee Referral Program to drive in more passive candidate.

Called back for a 2nd contract with Google.Sourcing and recruiting passive Software Engineering candidates for several North American Google locations through a variety of means including boolean, cold calling and creative search techniques.	Consistently averaging 150% of quarterly goals.Versed with Salesforce and other Applicant Tracking Systems.Partner with recruiters from Site Reliability Engineering, Platforms and Leadership teams to collaborate and share candidates.Participated in coaching sessions and resume reviews for the Google Boulder Geta.job event.Proactively created and implemented a sourcing contest for the Boulder sourcing teams to encourage more collaboration amongst recruiters.Helping to mentor newly hired recruiters and providing sourcing ideas and assistance.

Recruited both active and passive candidates for the Management Development Consultant roles.Averaged 125% of my quarterly goals.Acted as the point of contact for the Hiring Managers on Product Management Roles and disseminated that knowledge to other team members.Responsible for prescreening candidates, scheduling interviews, travel itineraries, reimbursement request, offer preparations and new start paperwork.Utilized Candidate management system, Taleo.

summary: As a recruiter I go above and beyond the typical recruiter job description.  I don't wait for the candidates to come to me, I am searching them out through different means.  I have implemented new tools to help us ensure we are focusing on candidate experience.  I am communicating with the hiring managers and continue to build their trust in me ad see me as a Business partner versus a work horse, although I am that as well.  I am in talks with Meetups and Conferences to figure out what events we should attend, what events we can speak at and what events we can have a presence at.  I am passionate about employer brand and candidate experience. I own a farm and currently have 7 horses,  2 cows, 2 dogs and a cat.  When i am done with work I am outside riding, feeding or cleaning.  I love Denver Broncos and STL Cardinals, although I don't know any players so you might think i'm not.   Why STL Cardinals you might ask, I went to school in Missouri and fell in love and have been a fan since.  I played soccer and was a goalkeeper all through college, although I have not played much in a few years.  I also love to shoot my compound bow and can get a good cluster going.
